title: Kinsman Stable
text:
Kinsman Stable is the "<a href="Glossary%20of%20North%20American%20horse%20racing">nom de course</a>" for the <a href="United%20States">American</a> <a href="Thoroughbred">Thoroughbred</a> <a href="horse%20racing">racing</a> <a href="stable">stable</a> of <a href="George%20Steinbrenner">George Steinbrenner</a>, best known as the owner of the <a href="New%20York%20Yankees">New York Yankees</a> <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> team. A director and former president of the Florida Thoroughbred Breeders' and Owners' Association, Steinbrenner became involved with the sport in the early 1970s and owned the Kinsman Stud Farm in <a href="Ocala%2C%20Florida">Ocala, Florida</a> where his Thoroughbreds are stabled. His son <a href="Hank%20Steinbrenner">Hank</a> and daughter Jessica are both involved in the business. 
As of 2008, Kinsman Stable has bred and/or raced more than thirty-five <a href="Graded%20stakes%20race">stakes</a> winners. In 2005 their colt <a href="Bellamy%20Road%20%28horse%29">Bellamy Road</a> won the <a href="Wood%20Memorial%20Stakes">Wood Memorial Stakes</a> and was then sent off as the <a href="Parimutuel%20betting">betting</a> favorite in the <a href="Kentucky%20Derby">Kentucky Derby</a> but finished seventh to the winner, <a href="Giacomo%20%28horse%29">Giacomo</a>. For 2008, the stable had another Derby prospect in <a href="Hopeful%20Stakes%20%28United%20States%29">Hopeful Stakes</a> winner, Majestic Warrior.
